p: Immunohistochemistry showed the presence of RVFV antigen as small foci spread throughout the placentomes collected at 4 dpi in experiments 1 and 2 ( Fig 4A). These foci consisted of a cluster of strongly stained epithelial/syncytial cells of the maternal villus with occasionally a single positive trophoblast in the epithelial lining of the opposite foetal villus ( Fig 4B). Clusters of RVFV-positive cells were also found in the trophoblast epithelium lining the haemophagous zone ( Fig 4C).
